messages.author: Ken Russell
messages.text: This violates a large number of abstraction barriers. app/ isn't allowed to reach up and touch chrome/ . You'll need to figure out a different structuring. If the message needs to be sent in response to setting the context's size, then I suggest adding a callback to the GLContext class and setting that callback (which would do this work) in gpu_processor_linux.cc.

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/22 22:49:52, kbr wrote:
> This violates a large number of abstraction barriers. app/ isn't allowed to
> reach up and touch chrome/ . You'll need to figure out a different structuring.
> If the message needs to be sent in response to setting the context's size, then
> I suggest adding a callback to the GLContext class and setting that callback
> (which would do this work) in gpu_processor_linux.cc.

Done. Thanks for catching this. I used your callback suggestion, but I had to go one level higher up to GpuCommandBufferStub to satisfy checkdeps.
